title: EU to Roll Out European Space Shield Initiative in 2026
summary:
As part of its Defence Readiness Roadmap 2030, the European Commission has unveiled the European Space Shield, a new initiative aimed at protecting space assets and services against “growing threats.” During a Joint Communication by the European Commission and the European External Action Service, the diplomatic arm of the EU, the Preserving Peace – Defence […]
The post EU to Roll Out European Space Shield Initiative in 2026 appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Taiwan should build a space-enabled kill web, not big warships
summary:
As part of a broader modernization effort, United States defense assistance should focus on freeing Taiwan’s senior military leadership from outdated paradigms by embedding multi-domain operations, joint training and campaign-level wargaming. The Pentagon’s most valuable contribution is doctrinal and architectural: helping Taiwan build a kill web — a distributed sensor-to-shooter network spanning space, air, sea […]
The post Taiwan should build a space-enabled kill web, not big warships appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Orion installed on SLS as Artemis 2 preparations continue during shutdown
summary:
The Orion spacecraft for the Artemis 2 mission has been installed on its Space Launch System rocket as preparations for the circumlunar flight continue despite a government shutdown.
The post Orion installed on SLS as Artemis 2 preparations continue during shutdown appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Starlink mini lasers to link Muon Space satellites for near real-time connectivity
summary:
SpaceX is supplying optical terminals to Muon Space, the four-year-old Californian manufacturer said Oct. 21, enabling its future Halo satellites to use the Starlink broadband constellation as a global data-relay network.
The post Starlink mini lasers to link Muon Space satellites for near real-time connectivity appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: ESA-supported test leads to better in-flight connectivity
summary: Better in-flight streaming and video-calling might just become more accessible thanks to a project supported by the European Space Agency (ESA). Building upon the success of an experiment for a new type of antenna terminal together with ESA, Viasat – a global leader in satellite communications – now plans to commercialise its new in-flight connectivity solution called Viasat Amara.

title: Coming Soon: ESA Student Internships 2026
summary: Are you ready to take your first step into the space sector? The countdown has begun for the launch of the European Space Agency's 2026 Student Internship Programme, and you could be part of it. Applications open the first week of November.

title: Landspace begins final preparations for China’s first orbital launch and landing attempt
summary:
Launch startup Landspace is in the final stages of preparations for the first launch of its Zhuque-3 rocket and a potentially landmark mission for China.
The post Landspace begins final preparations for China’s first orbital launch and landing attempt appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Sentinel-4 offers first glimpses of air pollutants
summary: The new Copernicus Sentinel-4 mission has delivered its first images, highlighting concentrations of atmospheric nitrogen dioxide, sulphur dioxide and ozone. Despite being preliminary, these images mark a major milestone in Europe’s ability to monitor air quality all the way from geostationary orbit, 36 000 kilometres above Earth.

title: Belgian startup Nxgsat raises early funds for virtual 5G satellite modem
summary:
A Belgian startup led by satellite networking veterans announced $1.4 million in seed funding Oct. 21 to develop a virtual 5G modem, designed for multi-orbit compatibility across traditionally closed communications infrastructure.
The post Belgian startup Nxgsat raises early funds for virtual 5G satellite modem appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: The mystery object that struck a plane in flight? It was probably a weather balloon
summary: WindBorne says its balloons are compliant with all applicable airspace regulations.
